diff_hunk:
@@ -86,7 +87,8 @@ def report_uninitialized_resources(resource_list=None,
     resource_list = shared_resources() + local_resources()
   with ops.name_scope(name):
     # Run all operations on CPU
-    with ops.device("/cpu:0"):
+    local_device = os.environ.get("TF_LOCAL_DEVICE", "/cpu:0")
body:
@martinwicke @ispirmustafa I agree with you in some way. The root cause of this bug is device setting. When only '/cpu:0' is assigned, the runtime will pick the first job name and task index in alphabet order to fill the device name. That is why '/job:ps/task:0/cpu:0' was used when running in ps-worker mode. I can not evaluate what is the impact when the default device placement is changed. So I just fix the problem from python client to cover all '/cpu:0'. 

I will change the key to TF_DEVICE_FOR_UNINITIALIZED_VARIABLE_REPORTING for this case first. Maybe another key will be required to fix other '/cpu:0'.
